benchmark_details.name: OK-VQA (Object Retrieval for Visual Question Answering with Outside Knowledge)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces the task of object retrieval for visual question answering with outside knowledge, proposing a multi-scale group collaborative embedding learning (MS-GCEL) method for general object retrieval. The study includes the establishment of an OK-VQA evaluation benchmark.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the precision and relevance of visual question answering by improving object-level retrieval methods.

data.source: Images extracted from COCO 2017, VOC 2007, BelgaLogos, Visual Genome, and LVIS datasets.
data.size: 121,298 training images, 9,904 validation images, 108,077 Generalization evaluation images.
data.annotation: Objects extracted using the segment anything model (SAM).

methodology.calculation: Recall@1 measures the accuracy of the top 1 retrieved object, while mAP is computed based on ranking indices of matching objects.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Recall@1 and mAP indicate better performance in object retrieval and question answering tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: STML (previous method) performance serves as a baseline for evaluation against the proposed MS-GCEL method.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation performed on various datasets to assess the generalization capability of the MS-GCEL model.
